articles.title: Kim Jong Il Greets  Vietnam Communist Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Greets  Vietnam Communist Party Leader
Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il sent a congratulatory message to Nong Duc Manh, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam, Sunday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Vietnam.
					 The message said:
					
					 I extend warm congratulations and greetings to you and, through you, to the Communist Party and the friendly people of Vietnam on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between our two countries.
					
					 The bilateral relations are precious as they were provided personally by President Kim Il Sung, the great leader of our people, and respected President Ho Chi Minh of the Vietnamese people, and the two peoples have steadily developed in depth the bonds of friendship and cooperation on the road for independence against imperialism and for socialism over the past 60 years.
					
					 Convinced that the friendly and cooperative relations between our two parties, countries and peoples with a long history and excellent tradition will be further developed in the future, I wholeheartedly wish your people bigger success in their efforts to build rich, powerful and prosperous Vietnam true to the behests of President Ho Chi Minh under the leadership of the Communist Party of Vietnam with you as its general secretary.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Greets Vietnam President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Greets Vietnam President 
Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Nguyen Minh Triet, President of Vietnam, Sunday on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries.
					 In the message Kim said that the bilateral relations of friendship provided by President Kim Il Sung and President Ho Chi Minh have been consolidated and developed in political, economic, cultural and other fields in the common struggle for socialism over the past 60 years.
					
					Expressing belief that these relations of friendship and cooperation with a long history and tradition would grow stronger, the message sincerely wished the President and people of Vietnam greater success in their efforts to build a rich and powerful country.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Greets Vietnam PM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Greets Vietnam PM 
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Kim Yong Il Sunday sent a message of greetings to Nguyen Tan Dung, prime minister of Vietnam, on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries.
					 Expressing belief that the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation with six decades-long history and good tradition would steadily develop in all fields, the message wished him and the Vietnamese government greater successes in their work for the industrialization and modernization of the country and the improvement of people's standard of living.
					
					 Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his Vietnamese counterpart Pham Gia Khiem who doubles as deputy prime minister on the same day.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Greets Vietnam Parliament Chairman
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Greets Vietnam Parliament Chairman
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Sunday sent a message of greetings to Nguyen Phu Trong, chairman of the National Assembly of Vietnam, on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries.
					 Expressing belief that the relations between the two assemblies established and developed in the common struggle for socialism would develop on better terms in the future, the message wished him success in his responsible work and good health.

articles.title: Reception Given in Hanoi
articles.content:
Reception Given in Hanoi
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The DPRK embassy in Hanoi gave a reception on Jan. 28 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic relations between the DPRK and Vietnam.
					 Present there on invitation were the deputy prime minister of Vietnam who doubles as foreign minister, the chairman of the National Council of the National Assembly, the permanent vice-chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam, a vice foreign minister, a deputy chief of the General Staff of the Vietnam People's Army, the permanent vice-chairman of the Vietnam Union of Friendship Organizations, the chairman of the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Association and other personages of various circles.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Pham Gia Khiem, deputy prime minister of Vietnam who doubles as foreign minister, said the Vietnamese people were pleased to note that the friendly and cooperative relations between Vietnam and the DPRK provided by President Ho Chi Minh and President Kim Il Sung have steadily grown stronger.
					
					 The Vietnamese party, government and people have always set store by the good relations of friendship and cooperation with those of the DPRK, and hoped that these ties would be developed in the interests of the two peoples as required by the new century to contribute to the peace and security, cooperation and development in the Asia-Pacific region and the rest of the world, he noted.
					
					 Expressing expectation that the Vietnam-DPRK relations would achieve fresh development in 2010 thanks to the concerted efforts of the two parties, governments and peoples, he continued: 
					
					 The Vietnamese people are greatly pleased with the great successes made by the fraternal Korean people in the nation-building.
					
					 He sincerely hoped that the fraternal Korean people would register new greater successes under the leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il and thus successfully open the gate to a thriving nation in 2012, the centenary of the birth of Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Meeting Held in Hanoi
articles.content:
Meeting Held in Hanoi
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A meeting took place in Hanoi on January 28 to mark the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Vietnam.
					 Present there were a vice-chairman of the National Assembly of Vietnam, the permanent vice-chairman of the Commission for External Affairs of the Communist Party of Vietnam, a vice foreign minister, the permanent vice-chairman of the Vietnam Union of Friendship Organizations, the chairman of the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Association and other personages of the Communist Party of Vietnam, the Foreign Ministry, the Defence Ministry, the Vietnam Union of Friendship Organizations, the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Club and media and others.
					
					 Present there on invitation were the DPRK ambassador to Vietnam and staff members of his embassy.
					
					 Speeches were made there.
					
					 Pham Tat Dong, chairman of the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Association, said that the Vietnamese people always remember the valuable support rendered by the party, state and fraternal people of the DPRK to them in their struggle for national independence and reunification of the country and feel grateful for it.
					
					General Secretary Nong Duc Manh visited the DPRK and held talks with General Secretary
						 Kim Jong Il in October of 2007, he recalled, stressing that the leaders of the two countries clarified the two countries' stands of attaching importance to the development of the bilateral traditional relations of friendship and cooperation.
					
					He hoped that the Korean people would register bigger successes in their efforts for building a great, prosperous and powerful nation and achieving national reunification under the leadership of
						 Kim Jong Il and the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation would grow stronger.
					
					 The meeting was followed by a performance given by Vietnamese artistes.

articles.title: Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy
articles.content:
Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy in Hanoi
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Floral baskets were sent to the DPRK embassy in Hanoi on January 28 on the occasion of the 60th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the DPRK and Vietnam. They were from the Commission for External Affairs of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Vietnam, the Foreign Ministry, the Defence Ministry, the Ministry of Industry and Commerce, the Ministry of Culture, Sports and Tourism, the Ministry of Agriculture and Rural Development and the Fatherland Front of Vietnam, the Vietnam Women's Union, the Vietnam Union of Friendship Organizations, the Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Association, the Diplomatic Corp Service Department, the General Department of National Reserve, the Ho Chi Minh Museum and other political parties, ministries of the government, organizations and institutions.

articles.title: Credentials of Polish Ambassador Accepted
articles.content:
Credentials of Polish Ambassador Accepted
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, was presented with credentials by Edward Pietrzyk, ambassador of Poland to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall on Monday.
					 After receiving the credentials, Kim had a talk with the ambassador.

articles.title: Officials Enjoy Opera "Evgeni Onegin"
articles.content:
Officials Enjoy Opera "Evgeni Onegin"
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- A trial performance of Opera "Evgeni Onegin" was given at the music hall of Pyongyang Kim Won Gyun Conservatory on Sunday.
					 Among the audience were senior party and state officials, officials of ministries and national institutions and creators, artistes, journalists and editors in the fields of culture and arts and media.
					
					 This opera of Russia, which was performed in the presence of President Kim Il Sung in 1958, has been reproduced by the conservatory as required by the new century.
					
					 The opera, based on a verse novel written by Pushkin, a famous Russian poet, and composed by Tchaikovsky, exposes through the portrayal of hero of the opera Evgeni Onegin the corrupt life of the aristocratic class and the injustice of the Russian feudal society that reduced to good-for-nothing and spoiled the young people who should have done a lot of good work for the country.
					
					 The first trial performance of the opera, which received help from Russian experts, was directed by Gus Anatoli Nikitovich, chief conductor of the State Academic Igor Moiseyev Dance Company of Russia.

articles.title: Great Advance Speed of Songun Korea
articles.content:
Great Advance Speed of Songun Korea
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Korean service personnel and people are accelerating the building of a great, prosperous and powerful nation at the "Huichon speed," a new Chollima speed.
					General Secretary Kim Jong Il, when visiting construction sites of the Huichon Power Station at the beginning of this year, appreciated the builders for creating a new advance speed of Songun Korea and encouraged them to give full play to the revolutionary spirit of the heroic country once again.
					
					Such great advance speeds recorded in the history of the socialist construction in Korea as the Chollima speed, "Pyongyang speed", "vinalon speed" and "speed of the 1980s" were all created in the heroic efforts for implementing the ideas and intentions of President Kim Il Sung and  Kim Jong Il.
					
					 The newly created "Huichon speed" that inspires the army and people to perform fresh miracles and feats is what the harmonious whole of the leader, the army and the people has brought about.
					
					 It, also a product of the revolutionary soldier spirit, reflects the unanimous desire and strong will of the Korean service personnel and people to build a thriving nation, a Juche-oriented socialist power, as early as possible and represents their gigantic spiritual strength for realizing the purpose.
					
					 All of them are now striving hard to effect a drastic turn in the improvement of the people's living standard so as to make this year marking the 65th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea as a prosperous year replete with the people's happiness, a year of weighty significance in the history of the building of a thriving nation.

articles.title: US Urged to Drop Its Cold War-Style Way of Thinking
articles.content:
US Urged to Drop Its Cold War-Style Way of Thinking 
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The assistant secretary of the U.S. State for East Asian and Pacific Affairs recently blustered that the United States has "maintained security and stability" in the East Asia-Pacific region for the last half a century and "the military forces" forward deployed in the Asia-Pacific region "should be continuously kept to defend peace and stability". And he claimed that "there can be no error in the fixed resolution to fulfill the commitment to defense", asserting that the U.S. will actively cooperate with south Korea "to modernize the military alliance."
					 Rodong Sinmun Monday observes in a signed commentary in this regard:
					
					 This is a revelation of the U.S. Cold War-style way of thinking which turns away from the issues of denuclearizing the Korean Peninsula and ensuring peace there as it brought to light the U.S. sinister intention for permanent military presence in the Asia-Pacific region including south Korea and its vicinity and invasion of the DPRK.
					
					 It was entirely thanks to the peace-loving DPRK's persevering efforts that a war has been averted and peace been preserved on the Korean Peninsula where the situation has constantly been pushed to the brink of a war.
					
					 The U.S. talk about "necessity" of its forces' presence in the Asia-Pacific region and "modernization of military alliance" with south Korea is nothing but an attempt to stifle the DPRK by force and hold unchallenged military hegemony in the region.
					
					 It is the U.S. bellicose forces' attempt for aggression to ignite a new Korean war with the method of preemptive strike by mobilizing the U.S. modern task forces.
					
					 The "fulfillment of the commitment to defense" and the "keeping of the U.S. forces" touted by the U.S. clearly prove once again that it seeks to retain edge of strength and put into practice its strategy for preemptive attack at any cost.
					
					 The U.S. would be well advised to coolly face up to the reality, dismantle the Cold War structure created by it in Northeast Asia as soon as possible and stop the reckless military rackets.

articles.title: KPA Statement Supported in Switzerland
articles.content:
KPA Statement Supported in Switzerland
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee issued a statement on Jan. 25 in support of the statement of a spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army.
					 The south Korean puppet defense minister, who asserted in March 2008 that south Korea would make "preemptive strike" at the nuclear bases of the DPRK with precision guided missiles, blustered again some days ago that "preemptive strike" would be mounted if necessary to cope with "nuclear threat" from the DPRK, the statement pointed out, noting that in this regard the KPA General Staff declared the principled stand of the revolutionary armed forces.
					
					 These treacherous, shameless and enraging utterances for "preemptive strike" clearly prove that the south Korean authorities' call for "improved south-north relations" is nothing but pretence and a foolish trick and empty talk, the statement said.
					
					 Bitterly condemning the south Korean authorities' doctrine of "preemptive strike", the statement urged the south Korean puppet clique to immediately stop the criminal war scenario for aggression.

articles.title: Joint New Year Editorial Hailed in Russia and Ukraine
articles.content:
Joint New Year Editorial Hailed in Russia and Ukraine
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Seminars on the joint New Year editorial of the DPRK were held by the Russian Youth Association for the Study of the Juche Idea and the Ukrainian Independence Federation on Jan. 15 and 24.
					 The main contents of the joint editorial were briefed before speeches were made there.
					
					 Referring to the achievements made by the Korean people in their efforts to build a thriving nation last year, the speakers said that the DPRK set it as the general orientation of action for this year to conduct a sweeping campaign to bring about a drastic turn in improving the people's standard of living and thus demonstrated once again the advantages of Korean-style socialism centered on the popular masses.
					
					An appeal was made at the seminar in Ukraine. It called upon the Juche idea followers the world over to launch a vigorous campaign for celebrating as a great revolutionary holiday the 65th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea this year when noteworthy events will be recorded in the history of
						 Kim Il Sung's nation and mankind.
					
					 Meanwhile, the Federal Leadership of the Left Bloc of the Austrian Trade Union Federation sent a letter of solidarity to the Central Committee of the General Federation of Trade Unions of Korea on Jan. 25 in support of the joint editorial and the statement of the DPRK Foreign Ministry.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Birthday to Be Celebrated in Denmark and Pakistan
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Birthday to Be Celebrated in Denmark and Pakistan
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- Preparatory committees for celebrating February 16, the birthday of General Secretary Kim Jong Il, were inaugurated in Denmark and Pakistan with due ceremony on Jan. 25 and 21.
					 Anders Kristensen, chairman of the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, was elected chairman of the Danish preparatory committee and Taji Haider, general secretary of the Sind Provincial Committee of the Pakistan People's Party who is member of the Party Central Executive Committee, chairman of the Pakistani preparatory committee.
					
					 The Danish preparatory committee set the days from Jan. 25 to Feb. 18 as a celebration period and decided to widely introduce the greatness and undying exploits of Kim Jong Il and conduct brisk activities of supporting the Korean people in the efforts for a great prosperous and powerful nation and national reunification in this period.
					
					 The Pakistani preparatory committee set the days from Jan. 21 to Feb. 20 as a celebration period and decided to hold such colorful events as meeting, seminar, film show and photo exhibition in this period.

articles.title: Story of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Story of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, February 1 (KCNA) -- On August 10, Juche 52 (1963) President Kim Il Sung called at a house in a village of forestry workers during his visit to Samjiyon.
					 In the kitchen he looked into a cupboard with bowls of boiled rice and dishes of pollack and bellflower root on its shelves and opened a lidded kimchi pot to find it empty.
					
					 He asked the housewife kindly why she didn't prepare kimchi.
					
					 She drooped her head, finding no word in reply.
					
					 An official answered instead of her that vegetables could not be cultivated well in the area.
					
					 The President went outside and fell into meditation for a while. He then happened to see a leaf-mustard blossom among potatoes growing in the garden.
					
					 He said the blossom showed that cabbage and radish would grow well there and that they should try to cultivate them.
					
					 The officials were deeply impressed by the President's deep concern for vegetable farming in alpine areas for their people's diet.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il felicita a Nong Duc Manh
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il felicita a Nong Duc Manh
Pyongyang, 1 de febrero (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il envio el 31 de enero un mensaje de felicitacion a Nong Duc Manh, Secretario General del CC del Partido Comunista de Vietnam (PCV) en ocasion del 60o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea y la Republica Socialista de Vietnam.
					  La misiva senala:
					
					  En ocasion del 60o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre nuestros dos paises hago llegar a usted y, por su conducto, al PCV y al amistoso pueblo vietnamita la calurosa felicitacion y el cordial saludo.
					
					  Las relaciones de los dos paises, Corea y Vietnam, devienen las preciosas preparadas personalmente por el Presidente Kim Il Sung, gran Lider de nuestro pueblo, y Ho Chi Minh, estimado Presidente del pueblo vietnamita.
					
					Durante los 60 anos pasados, los pueblos de nuestros dos paises han venido profundizando y desarrollando incesantemente los lazos de amistad y cooperacion en el camino antiimperialista por la independencia y el socialismo.
					
					  Convencido de que se ampliaran y se desarrollaran tambien en el futuro las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre nuestros dos partidos, dos paises y dos pueblos que tienen la larga historia y las excelentes tradiciones, deseo de todo corazon al pueblo vietnamita mayores exitos en su lucha por construir Vietnam poderoso y prospero segun el legado del Presidente Ho Chi Minh bajo la direccion del PCV que tiene a usted como Secretario General.

articles.title: Mitin por 60 anos de relaciones diplomaticas entre Corea y Vietnam
articles.content:
Mitin por 60 anos de relaciones diplomaticas entre Corea y Vietnam
						
Pyongyang, 1 de febrero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el 28 de enero en Hanoi el mitin por el 60o aniversario del establecimiento de las relaciones diplomaticas entre Corea y Vietnam.
					  En la ocasion participaron el vicepresidente de la Asamblea Nacional, el subjefe permanente de la Comision para Asuntos Exteriores del Comite Central del Partido Comunista (PC), el vicecanciller, el vicepresidente permanente de la Union de Organizaciones de Amistad (UOA), el presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Vietnam-Corea, y otras personalidades del PC, el Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores, el de Defensa Nacional, la UOA, el Club de Amistad Vietnam-Corea y de los organismos de prensa e informacion y los habitantes vietnamitas.
					
					  Entre los invitados se distinguian el embajador y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica coreana en ese pais.
					
					  En la ocasion hubo discursos.
					
					  Pham Tat Dong, presidente de la Asociacion de Amistad Vietnam-Corea, dijo que los vietnamitas no olvidan nunca el precioso apoyo y respaldo brindados por el partido, el Estado y el hermano pueblo de Corea a la lucha del pueblo vietnamita por la independencia nacional y la reunificacion del pais y estan agradecidos del respecto.
					
					  Al mencionar que en octubre de 2007, el Secretario General Nong Duc Manh visito Corea y sostuvo conversaciones con el Secretario General           Kim Jong Il, enfatizo que los dirigentes de los dos paises expusieron la posicion de dar importancia al desarrollo de las tradicionales relaciones bilaterales de amistad y cooperacion.
					
					  Deseo que bajo la direccion del Dirigente         Kim Jong Il, el pueblo coreano logre mayores exitos en la lucha por construir una gran potencia prospera y reunificar la patria y se consoliden las relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises.
					
					  Terminado el mitin, se ofrecio la funcion de los artistas vietnamitas.

articles.title: Cuadros presencian ensayo de la opera "Evgueni Oneguin"
articles.content:
Cuadros presencian ensayo de la opera "Evgueni Oneguin"
Pyongyang, 1 de febrero (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar el 31 de enero el ensayo de la opera "Evgueni Oneguin" en el teatro musical del Conservatorio Kim Won Gyun de Pyongyang.
					  Lo presenciaron los cuadros del partido y el Estado, los funcionarios de los ministerios y organismos centrales, los creadores, artistas, periodistas y redactores de los dominios de cultura y arte, prensa e informacion.
					
					  El Conservatorio Kim Won Gyun de Pyongyang reinterpreto conforme a la demanda del nuevo siglo esa opera rusa que habia mostrado al Presidente  Kim Il Sung en 1958. 
					
					  Mediante la actuacion del protagonista Evgueni Oneguin,  la opera basada en la novela en versos del famoso poeta ruso Puskin y compuesta musicalmente por Chaikowski revela y critica la vida corrupta del sector aristocratico, que deprava a los jovenes que deben hacer muchas cosas utiles para el pais, y las desventajas de la sociedad feudal de Rusia.
					
					  La primera funcion de ensayo, que conto con la ayuda de los especialistas rusos, fue dirigida por Anatoli Nikitovichi, director-jefe del Conjunto de Danza Folclorica Academica Nacional Igor Moiseyev de Rusia.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun insiste en que EE.UU. debe abandonar su modo de pensar
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun insiste en que EE.UU. debe abandonar su modo de pensar
Pyongyang, 1 de febrero (ATCC) -- Recientemente, el asistente del Secretario de Estado norteamericano para asuntos de Asia Oriental y el Pacifico, dijo que durante medio siglo pasado Estados Unidos "vino manteniendo la seguridad y la estabilidad" de la region de Asia Oriental y el Pacifico y "tiene que mantener de continuo las fuerzas militares" ubicadas en la region de Asia y el Pacifico para "defender alli la paz y la estabilidad". Y hablo de que EE.UU. cooperara activamente con el Sur de Corea para "modernizar la alianza militar" y anadio que "no podra haber el error en la firme decision de cumplir la promesa de defensa".
					Esto muestra su malsano intento de perpetuar el estacionamiento de las tropas yanquis en susodicha region incluyendo el Sur de Corea y su contorno y de agredir a Corea, y es una manifestacion del modo de pensar al estilo de guerra fria que da las espaldas a los asuntos de desnuclearizacion y el aseguramiento de la paz de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Asi senala el diario Rodong Sinmun en un comentario individual difundido este lunes y continua:
					
					En la Peninsula Coreana, donde la situacion llega al borde de la guerra, la paz se ha mantenido evitando la guerra, lo que se debe enteramente a los esfuerzos pacientes y pacifistas de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea.
					
					EE.UU. habla de la "necesidad" de la permanencia de sus tropas en la region de Asia y el Pacifico y de la "modernizacion de la alianza militar" con el Sur de Corea. Eso no pasa de ser un intento de aplastar militarmente a la RPDC y fortalecer la heguemonia militar en la citada region.
					
					  Las fuerzas belicas norteamericanas pretenden desatar la nueva guerra coreana con el ataque preventivo movilizando sus modernas fuerzas armadas de golpe movil.
					
					El "cumplimiento de promesa de defensa" y el "mantenimiento de las fuerzas armadas norteamericanas" de que habla EE.UU. vuelven a probar patentemente que este imperio intenta mostrar la supremacia de la fuerza y realizar a toda costa su estrategia de ataque preventivo.
					
					EE.UU. debe reflexionar sobre la realidad, eliminar cuanto antes las estructuras de guerra fria en la region del Nordeste Asiatico, creadas por si mismo, y poner fin a sus imprudentes alborotos militares.
